pageContext.claim: “The disgraced mayor of the city [Portland] has ordered the police to stand down in the face of rioters, leaving his citizens at the mercy of this mob. He was at the mercy of the mob, too. If you saw him go out there the other day, it was terrible.”
pageContext.analysis: The temporary restraining order on the Portland Police Bureau’s ability to use less lethal munitions for crowd control except when lives are at risk came as the result of a negotiation between the department and a non-profit suing them in federal court. It was not an edict from the mayor.
